dialogs.text: When did all my friends move over there? Don't they know it's still Block-your-local-bridge Day? They should stay here and keep listening to me.

choices.text: Or maybe you should go over to them.

dialogs.text: Yes! I knew someone still cared.
<size=80%>I won't abandon my post that easily! They'll come back. No one can live without hearing me for that long. I don't even know why they're lollygagging over there.

choices.text: They all gave up on Block-your-local-bridge Day.
They saw this really valuable rock at the bottom of the cliff.</size>

dialogs.text: I bet it pales in comparison to my popularity. No spot can be as loved as the one in front of me.
RevealResults14 Well that didn't work. I guess popularity just isn't as convincing as friendship. Not that I'm compaining, I'm happy to stay uneaten.
They could never! And even if they did, I stay loyal to the cause.
RevealResults10 Wow, people are dedicated! That doesn't really work out in our favor, though.
Woah, what is it? I bet we can make it on TV for something like that!
RevealResults08 They fell for it! Just like people who don't recognize subliminal messages. I think when they don't know exactly what someone's talking about, they blindly believe it exists. Heh heh.
Hah! I know there's no priceless rocks down there. If there was, I'd be rich and famous by now.
RevealResults18 Oops. It seems like someone trusts their memory if you're lying about something they would easily recognize.
RevealResults10 Looks like they wouldn't have given up even if they thought their friends did. People are dedicated!
RevealResults14 I guess using popularity just wouldn't have been as convincing as friendship. Not that I'm compaining, I'm happy to stay uneaten.
RevealResults18 It seems like someone would trust their memory more if you're lying about something they would easily recognize, like a shiny rock. Good thing this human wasn't an expert on wildlife.
So where's that incredible new discovery? I can't wait til the cameramen show up!
